identificationModule.briefTitle: Observation of Clinical Routine Care for Patients With BIOTRONIK Implantable Cardiac Monitors (ICMs)
identificationModule.officialTitle: BIO|STREAM.ICM: Observation of Clinical Routine Care for Patients With BIOTRONIK Implantable Cardiac Monitors (ICMs)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This registry is performed for the long-term assessment of outcome, performance and residual safety aspects of the BIOMONITOR III and possible successors in a real-life clinical set-up. In addition, this registry is set up in a way that it may also be used as a platform for submodules to investigate additional scientific and regulatory aspects while minimizing the additional effort for the investigational sites and patients.

primaryOutcomes.description: Device is intended to detect rare arrhythmias. Time to detect this relevant arrhytmia will be recorded.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).

secondaryOutcomes.description: Information on the Insertion procedure (Operation time, handling of the BIOMONITOR incl. incision and inserton tool); Success rate of insertions.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: It is considered that all patients are enrolled and subsequently inserted with the investigational device within 2 years after study start, i.e. until October 2021. Exchanges will be also considered for analysis

otherOutcomes.description: Quality of sensing Amplitude (Millivolt) and electrical noise (%) detected by the BIOMONITOR.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).

otherOutcomes.measure: Inspection results of the insertion site
otherOutcomes.description: Rating of wound healing and cosmetic outcome by the physician/patient (5-level scale).
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).

otherOutcomes.description: Patients opinion about the wearing comfort (5-level-scale).
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until Febraury 2023 (Last patient out).

otherOutcomes.description: Assessement whether the BIOMONITOR migrates under the skin.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).

otherOutcomes.measure: Diagnosis and clinical actions after arrhythmia detection
otherOutcomes.description: Documentation whether the BIOMONITOR helps to detect arrhythmias. Documentation of therapies used to treat these arrhythmias and whether the BIOMONITOR helps to monitor therapy success.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).

otherOutcomes.measure: Explantation / deactivation / exchange information of the BIOMONITOR
otherOutcomes.description: Collect information about explantation, deactivation and exchanges of the BIOMONITOR, such as number, reason, and data on procedure.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).
Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).

otherOutcomes.description: Collect and analyze device deficiencies. Calculate rate (frequency) of device deficiencies.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).

otherOutcomes.measure: Documentation of imaging techniques, if applied.
otherOutcomes.description: Documentation if patients underwent any MRI examinations or mammography. Documentation of exact kind of examination and occurrences with regard to the BIOMONITOR.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Data will be collected throughout the entire registry, i.e. until February 2023 (Last patient out).

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient is intended to receive a BIOTRONIK Implantable Cardiac Monitor (ICM)
* Patient is able to understand the nature of the registry and to provide written informed consent.
* Patient is willing and able to use the CardioMessenger and accepts the BIOTRONIK Home Monitoring concept.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient is pregnant or breast feeding.
* Patient is less than 18 years old.
* Patient is participating in another interventional clinical investigation other than the submodules of BIO\|STREAM.ICM
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: The intended patient population consists of all patients who would benefit from long-term cardiac rhythm monitoring.
